main event: A sighting of an unidentified aerial object was reported in Bakersfield, California on 13 August 1957, which was determined to be a meteoric form or fireball likely related to the Perseids meteor shower.
interesting points: The observation was believed to be a 'bolide' or 'fireball' associated with the meteoric swarm known as the Perseids, which occurs around the period of 9 - 13 August.
The description of the object resembled a well-known astronomer's description of fireballs, further supporting the conclusion of it being a meteoric event.
The letter from the witness expressing concern and interest in the sighting was acknowledged and referred to the Air Force for review and comment.
No photographs were included in the report or corresponding documents.
The report was forwarded to the Air Technical Intelligence Center for possible investigation and evaluation.
sighted object: Unidentified aerial object believed to be a 'bolide' or 'fireball'
photographs: No photographs included in the report
